item.title: Trump to Reimpose Aluminum Tariffs on Canada
item.description: Just a little over a month after implementing the new U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement designed to lower trade barriers across North America, the Trump administration has decided to reimpose tariffs on Canadian aluminum.

item.title: Former Saudi Spymaster Sues Crown Prince, Alleging Murder Attempt
item.description: A former Saudi Arabian intelligence official claims in a lawsuit that Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman dispatched a hit squad to Canada to assassinate him less than two weeks after dissident journalist Jamal Khashoggi was killed in Turkey.

item.title: Beirut Explosion: As Rescuers Search for Survivors, Families Criticize the Effort
item.description: Two days after a blast rocked Beirut, dozens of people remain missing. As rescue workers comb through rubble looking for survivors, families are increasingly angry with what they say has been a slow and incompetent effort.

item.title: Covid-19 Derails Latin America's Bid for Middle-Class Prosperity
item.description: The region faces a 9.4% GDP decline this year, the worst downfall on record, and will likely lag behind other emerging markets in any recovery. It’s a major blow for millions who were making the long climb out of poverty.

item.title: U.S.-South Korea Military Exercises Stay Digital, as North's Threat Grows
item.description: The U.S. and South Korea plan to start their third major combined military exercise using computer simulations as early as next week, two years after President Trump ordered field drills be scaled back.

item.title: Hong Kong Draws Fewer Expats as China Curbs City's Freedoms
item.description: The city’s expatriate community is shrinking, as new restrictions by China on speech and political activities and a tumultuous year of protests have diminished the allure of living and working in the Asian financial hub.
